metadata.dc:description: Ischemic gastropathy is highly infrequent in daily medical practice. In the last few years, the number of reported cases has increased. Although the guiding symptom is usually abdominal pain, the clinical spectrum of the disease is highly variable. Early diagnosis and treatment are essential to change the natural history of the disease. We present the case of a 75-year-old man with chronic abdominal pain who developed a fulminant form of necrotizing gastric ischemia and died within less than 24h.
metadata.dc:title: Isquemia gástrica fulminante: el estadio final de una enfermedad poco expresiva.
[Fulminant ischemic gastropathy: the final stage of a difficult-to-diagnose disease].
